meanings.definition: The quality of being heady or intoxicating.
meanings.sent1: The headinesses of the perfume filled the room with a strong, pleasant scent.
meanings.sent2: The headinesses of the wine made her feel a bit dizzy after just one glass.
meanings.sent3: The headinesses of the spicy food made his taste buds dance with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The headinesses of success can sometimes cloud one's judgment.
meanings.sent5: The headinesses of victory lingered in the air long after the game ended.

meanings.definition: The state of being arrogant or conceited.
meanings.sent1: Her headinesses often rubbed people the wrong way, as she always boasted about her achievements.
meanings.sent2: His headinesses were evident in the way he talked down to others.
meanings.sent3: The headinesses of the peacock made the other birds roll their eyes in amusement.
meanings.sent4: The headinesses of the lion made it believe it was the king of the jungle.
meanings.sent5: The headinesses of the celebrity made them forget their humble beginnings.
